hypothesis_content.title: Contrarian BTC Long on CME Futures Gap Closure in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: When a significant price gap (>1.5%) exists between the CME BTC futures Friday close and Sunday open, and the Monday spot market opens in the direction opposite to the gap in a NEUTRAL regime, the gap will close within 3 trading days, providing a mean-reversion entry opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: CME gaps have a strong historical tendency to fill. A move against the gap at the weekly open suggests initial overreaction is being rejected. The NEUTRAL regime and SMA band filter increase the odds of a range-bound, mean-reverting environment where this effect is strongest.
entry_conditions: CME Friday close to Sunday open gap magnitude > 1.5%
BTC spot price at Monday's 00:00 UTC open has moved *against* the gap (e.g., gap up, but price opens down)
Spot price is between the 20-day and 50-day SMA (range-bound confirmation)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Gap is fully closed (price reaches the Friday closing level)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves an additional 1.5% in the direction against the gap (beyond the open)
exit_conditions.time_exit: 3 trading days (72 hours) after Monday open

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 60% of such identified gaps close within the 3-day window, or the average return is negative.
